title: Marketing Web Developer Interview

Interview Questions: How will your boss know when you are overwhelmed with work?

title: ELP Engineer (Engineering Leadership Program) Interview

Interview Questions: What does it mean to be devoted to God?

title: Associate LifeKids Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The staff was very good at greeting us and keeping us informed of every step coming up. They made sure to keep the energy up and provided refreshments to keep us charged. They also provided calming spaces to help us decompress between interviews.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose LifeKids to do ministry at LifeChurch?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process occurred over the course of several months. It included tests, phone calls, and an in person interview. The tests were over topics such as grammar, math skills, and spiritual gifts, personality tests, and tests of that nature. The interview event itself was in Edmond, Oklahoma which we flew there for. Overall it was a rigorous but amazing process! I learned so much about myself and the internship hasn’t even begun.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you cut corners.

title: ELP Engineering Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: First of all I’d like to say the dedication to a thorough and robust interview process brings credit to individuals serving on the leadership team, to their ministry, and a core value of excellences show. I open with that because while the process was many steps and over many weeks every aptitude test and interview type was value added. I learned more about the behind the scenes and the employer than I had expected and they learned a lot about me. A significant and important difference with how Life.Church stands out is that my spouse was invited to several stages or phases of the interview process. The appreciation and understanding of how we work together in life to succeed was deeply felt and appreciated. Be prepared to know yourself well and to be provided with many challenges and resources to tackle those challenges throughout the process. From recruiting & talent acquisition to hiring managers and panel interviews the process was engagement but for me the most pleasant and meaningful for me to date in 15 years of professional work history. 20 years if you count jobs that helped me through college. Now with all this testing a lot of coordinating with schedules and staging out different phases was handled excellently and is subject to continuous improvement. So your process may be different than mine but you can expect to work with genuinely curious and professionally dedicated people with a high caliber of skills you could expect to see in any STEM / growth talent industry. Another significant and noteworthy stage was a central campus tour. You can tell people are comfortable working here and the intentionality is easily seen in the layout and setup or design of the office space. Soft glow light versus hard bright fluorescent makes the place feel inviting and welcoming! The campus is equipped better than any Fortune 500 or any campus I’ve toured to date in terms of amenities. New construction and expansion ongoing has well to facilitate growth!
Interview Questions: What would you do if two relation departments are competing for placement or rotation of the same engineer? Who’s department should get priority? How would you go about determining that?

title: Associate LGLM Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: How do I describe the interview process… amazing, challenging, tenuous, exciting, nerve-wracking, and so many other thoughts come to mind. It is clearly designed to bring all of your qualities to the surface. Kind of like how a tube of toothpaste being squeezed shows its colors, you will show yours in this interview process. And that’s a beautiful thing because it allows you to be able to know what your next step is with Life.Church quickly. The old adage goes that when pressure and heat are applied, you’ll create diamonds from coal, however this simply untrue. The diamonds have actually been there this entire time, and the interview process does a great job at uncovering the diamonds and reviewing the coal.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of questions and are genuinely interested in you as a person. They care a lot about your ministry career and want to make sure you are in the right place to step into full-time ministry. They cared enough to take the time to find a spot that worked better for me than the one I had applied to initially.

title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO) Interview

title: Senior Marketing and Communications Manager Interview

Interview Questions: What is your biggest obstacle to taking this role?

title: Worship Filmmaker Interview

title: Logistics Support Interview

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Life.Church

title: Associate Operations Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Two words.  Intentional and Intense
Be prepared to dive deep. 
Initial phone call, followed by 3 video interviews, then a 2 day global hiring event.  My journey was long as everyone hired goes to the hiring event, it depends on where you land in the cycle.  The overarching sentiment is that the interviewers truly care about you as a person.  They ask tough questions not to trip you up but as an opportunity to clarify how you fit into LC and how LC fits for you.
Interview Questions: Every question that is listed here in others interview reviews was asked.  They follow the Sustaining Attributes of LC and how, based on your earlier interviews, you have used or failed to use the attributes.  A lot of questions about how you handled situations and failures.

title: YouVersion Social Media Video Content Creator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions:
This was a pretty lengthy interview process, with 5 total interviews, 2 rounds of test projects, and additional pre-employment testing over the course of a month and a half. 

The test projects and pre-employment testing were actually a really great tool to help show my skills and allow the team to ask questions about how I work and what my process looks like. In these projects specifically, some where more detailed and gave a lot of direction, while others were more open-ended to see what I could come up with on my own. 

Each interview was about an hour long, except for the final interview which was closer to 2 hours in total. The YouVersion team asks some pretty in-depth questions and really vet their people well. And it's all out of a heart for really getting to know you as a person and making sure it's a good fit for everyone! 

Life.Church and YouVersion really value connection as a staff. They really do want to make sure you feel integrated into the team and feel seen and known. And because of that, it really helps to be open and honest about where you're at personally and professionally throughout the interview process. 

When I was flown out for my final interview, I also had coffee with my supervisor-to-be, and a few other guys on the YouVersion team in the morning before the interview, which really helped me feel at ease and feel like a part of the team before even being offered the job. 

The final interview itself was probably more intimidating than the first 4. It was in a room with 8 different people and was split up into 2 rounds of questions with a short break between them. And again, each person asked some pretty in-depth questions about how I work and how I respond to certain situations. And again, it was all out of a heart to see who I was as a person and make sure we would mesh well as a team.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you totally missed the mark on a project, and how did you react to that feedback? What's something you could have done to prevent that situation?

title: IT Specialist Interview

Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Digital Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jul 2022

title: Freelance Filmmaker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The process was thorough and organized. I had a total of five interviews, and over the course of those five interviews I spoke with 14 different employees at Life.Church. The questions I was asked touch on job experience, personal faith, leadership, marriage, conflict resolution skills, and lifestyle. I was and am very impressed with Life.Church’s intentionality and commitment toward finding unique people who fit their culture. It may sound like an oxymoron, but it’s true. When I was flown in to Oklahoma City for my final in-person interview, I was blown away by the authenticity of the Life.Church staff. I didn’t feel like I had to perform for acceptance, nor did the employees I was privileged to interact with. The final interview was intimidating to say the least. My wife and I were placed in a large room with an oddly-shaped table across from eight LC employees who worked in several different departments. Each of them took turns asking questions and answering ours. Midway through the interview, we were given a break which helped me calm my nerves and receive feedback from my wife. At the conclusion of the interview, we were provided lunch and we able to hear back from the hiring managers on the final results.

The only disappointment I have concerning the interview process is not being able to interact with an employee of my own race. When I brought this up in my final interview, the LC staff members were aware that they had fallen short in this aspect, apologetic, and receptive of my feedback.
Interview Questions: In what ways do you anticipate being spiritually attacked during your employment with Life.Church?

How do you embody them?

title: Project Manager Interview

It really shows why Life.Church is a world class workplace. I have learned a great deal about myself and will forever be thankful for this process!

title: Fulltime Filmmaker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions:
I have been trained in interviewing and based off of that knowledge: the interview process is pretty intense at Life.Church. You'll definitely want to prepare extensively with basic questions, creative questions and very deep/vulnerable questions. They are not afraid to put you on the spot and will not shy away from personal topics. There is no malicious intent but it can be pretty intense to be the one on the hotseat. Before I interviewed, it was made clear to me that many people are known to cry during the interview process, and I found that to be true even for me. 

If you are married they will allow you to bring your spouse along which I would imagine can be incredibly helpful. 

During my time there (I will try my best to remember), the process began with a type of "speed-date" style interviewing where you were given 5 minutes or so with 2-3 people before switching to another set of 2-3 people. The questions here are more basic, low-intensity and general and it's meant to be fast. This goes on for 6-8 sets of people before the second phase of the interview begins. The second phase is more intimate as you are in a room with 3 sets of 2-3 people, each set spending about 15-20 minutes with you. The questions in this phase are very personal and intense. After that, you are free to go and the interviewers all enter a conference room to discuss each candidate one-by-one. Thankfully, you are not there for this portion.

However, I had another interview with Life.Church where a portion of the interview was in a conference room with about 5 people and they all took turns asking me a variety of questions. But I cannot say if that was standardized interviewing procedure or if it was specific to the job I was applying for.

All that to say your best course of action is to: prepare your answers ahead of time, be ready to be honest/vulnerable and definitely don't forget to pray!
Interview Questions:
(Forgive me as I cannot remember many)
3 of your best qualities & 3 of your worst qualities.
Tell me a joke ("I can't think of one" or "I'm more of a witt person" are not acceptable answers!)
Why do you want a job in ministry
Worst feedback you've ever received
Worst failure you've ever experienced and what did you learn
Worst mistake you've ever made

A difficulty you had at a job?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: Apply, initial phone conversation, scheduled interview date, multiple round mini interview with many questions with different people and opportunity to share communication abilities, call next day of job was received
Interview Questions: What is one area you know you need to grow in?

title: Construction Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Many rounds of interviews. First-round with line manager, the second-round was a group interview. The third round was a big online test and 4th round debriefs and 5th round case practice and last round interview with a spouse.
Interview Questions: What's your weakness? And share one mistake /failor you have made in your work?

title: Church to Church Resources and Support Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a phone screening, followed by an initial interview. Then a set of online personality and aptitude tests were sent to be taken. Another interview was conducted where we went over the results of the tests. A final interview was held and a call was made to extend the offer post interview. The process was intense but encouraging.
Interview Questions: Q: What does your relationship with Christ look like right now?

title: Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: Grueling interview process. Be prepared for at least 4-5 different interviews (via phone calls or video chats), including a large group interview with multiple people from a variety of areas asking broad rapid fire questions.
Interview Questions:
Q: What is authority?
Q: Tell me about a time you had a conflict.
Q: How healthy is your marriage?

title: Database Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very different experience for me. When you are being interviewed in a regular place, you feel the pressure, and you feel like you are being evaluated and tested the whole time. But at Life Church was different. This a very serious place, and they execute the whole process very seriously (I think I had to go through 7 steps), and of course, I was being tested and evaluated, but I did not feel the pressure. I felt comfortable enough to be clear and transparent. For the first time, I knew they were really concerned if the position would be suitable for them as much as it would be for me.
Interview Questions: They really want to know you, so I question that everyone will ask you to tell your story.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: As many of these reviews have stated, it is a very thorough interview process. For me, everything was explained in the initial phone screen. This was followed by a video interview. After that, if you move on, you take several tests. You will then have an interview to go over your results. The final interview is with multiple people and usually broken up into 30 min sections. Due to Covid, I did this online, however, it usually done on campus.
Interview Questions: What is something in your current job that motivates you? What is something that drains you?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
1. Applied online on their website
2. Received an email to schedule a time for a phone interview
3. Talked with a recruiter on the scheduled time
4. Received an email for rejection
Interview Questions: What are your 2 strengths and weaknesses?

title: Digital Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: Mostly asked questions relating to your religion and beliefs.  Didn't seem to care about my business experience. They even passively changed the topic anytime I mentioned it.  Also kept asking about my fiancee to find out if we were living together or not.
Interview Questions:
Tell us a joke.
What would the devil do to come between you and your career and personal life?

title: Associate Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It had a lot of variety, beginning with a phone screening, then followed by an initial video interview and project. After getting through those initial phases, they paid for my wife and I to visit Edmond and have the final interview in person.
Interview Questions: What was one recent significant failure you had, and how did you deal with it?

title: Site Reliability Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
No real technical questions whatsoever. Only typical interview questions followed by constant persistence on whether you assist their particular brand of church and if you're willing to fully commit to theirs, regardless of whether you're a Christian or not and what that actually means to you and what it has cost you.

The people doing the interview didn't know anything about the subject matter, they were placed there (apparently based on availability) only to see if you would be willing to live according to their Church doctrine. No heads up was given about this unusual, awkward and strange approach.

Besides that, the pay is a little on the low side even for their market plus you have to do Voluntary work and assist their particular Church. But that would be all o.k., and in the right context even great!! Except for one detail: 
 I've never experienced anything so awkward and strange in my professional life. It was really off-putting. 
I understand this is a non-profit and that non-profits do get some exceptions on Chapter VII but I didn't find it that ethical to be asking if a person is going to agree with your organization as if it was an army: 100%, 100% of the time, much less a non-profit,  before asking the very first actual technical question on the subject matter to measure competency.

Given the negative reviews posted here I can't say I'm  surprised, they are probably trying to reduce their turn around and for their applicants to end up disappointing themselves by turning a blind eye due to excitement and then finding out they're not pleased with their decision, on either end.
I wouldn't recommend unless you're a previous member of their Church and want to serve them or don't care about your individuality in the face of other human beings telling you how to think.
At the very least, it was optional. Through their awkward persistence they did give me an opportunity to make a decision and I decided against moving further.
Interview Questions: Watch our Live stream and see if you would like to move to basically live inside this Church, even before we know if you can get the actual job done.

title: Senior Software Engineer and Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews over several days, as well as online testing.  Very thorough and professional, but also felt like they were truly wanting to get to know me and my spouse.
Interview Questions: What are my top  strengths and weaknesses

title: Infrastructure Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions:
Awesome process, initial interview phone call, honest, open, and personal. Obviously looking for the proper fit, and that’s a good thing.

More interviews to come I hope as we move to the next part of the process
Interview Questions: What is your favorite joke

title: Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
For Life.Church, there are 2 main types of interviews, namely those for Central roles (those that help the whole church) and Location/Ministry roles (ones specific to a Campus). My role is at Central and it had 4 steps.
1. Phone screening: about a 30 min conversation that covered general things, including what my salary expectations were.
2. Phone call: I was remote when I applied, so I got a phone call instead of an in person visit. Again, this was 30 min and was more specific to my history, calling, and expectations moving forward.
3. Skills Assessment: A series of like 5 different kinds of tests from personality to problem solving, etc. This also comes with a debrief conversation. The main point is to know yourself and share about who you are.
4. Final interview: Mine was over Zoom cause of COVID. It was 2 45-min sessions with my spouse. Questions were about my work history, calling, marriage relationship, product questions, etc.
5. A video call job offer: Later that day I got a video call offering me the the job. They also asked my wife what her resume was because they were interested in her working at Life.Church as well.
Interview Questions:
Since you have not been a Product Manager before, what relevant experiences do you have?
How would you describe your relationship with Jesus?
Since this role is located at Central, are you willing to relocate?
What has been a struggle in your marriage?
(To my spouse) How does your spouse respond to stress?

title: Ios Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was a little long but it was during the holidays, so i believe that this must has affected the timing. Over all it was an amazing experience with lots of prayers.
Interview Questions: Questions varied between personal, technical, and spiritual.

title: Staff Kids Educator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and great communication. Very friendly and made me feel very comfortable. Very clear on expectations and deciding mutually if I would be a good fit.  It was more of a conversation a nd getting to know one another.
Interview Questions: What I could bring to the table

title: Host Team LXP Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: First is a round robin speed round which had 8-10 groups with 3-4 questions each.  You have a couple minutes at each group. Then two 30 minute interviews with 2-3 people. At the second 30 minute interview they want to know what you learned from the first. You’re also required to do a “huddle”. It’s a very hard and intense day.
Interview Questions: What is one way you have cut corners in the past? Why did you cut corners that way? What was the outcome?

title: Marketing and Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen, a series of exams, an assignment, a follow up call to review my assignment and testing and an in-person day of interviews. The entire process provided an incredible journey that really encouraged both my husband and I to understand the impact that we could have both personally and professionally by working in ministry. It was clear that Life.Church cares deeply about an entire family—rather than just the individual they're hiring.
Interview Questions: How would working in ministry put a target on your back?

title: Engineering Leadership Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process with Life.Church is probably the most intensive process I have experienced. If you are reading this as someone just about to go through the process, I'd actually recommend refraining from going through reviews until the end of the process. I didn't check glassdoor until my final interview, and that actually helped me as the entire process is very unorthodox. 

My first interview was phone screen, and it was probably the most fun I've had in an interview. My interviewer asked very interesting question that caught me off guard many times. No youtube video could prepare me for this call, and the same can be said about the entire interview process. 

There was a period of about one week between each round of interview.  By the final interview, six weeks had passed, and I went through a rollercoaster of emotions. I figured, and was later confirmed, that this was all an intentional part of the interview. I loved it and hated it at the same time. I personally get very excited initiallly and regret the decisions I make later on, so having this process force me to take my time benefited me signficantly. It's as if they saw my weakness and adjusted the process to help both sides.

All in all, I had an amazing experience. Even if I wasn't offered the job, I still would've benefited from the process. Every person I interacted with from HR and the interviewers themselves were amazing and very helpful. I'm glad to be a part of the team!
Interview Questions: What excites you about the opportunity?

title: Creative Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: Life.Church's process is very detailed, lengthy and fun. They hire top notch people from each field, so they are very intentional in their interview process. The last part of my interview process involved me bringing my husband to a panel interview. I really appreciated and enjoyed that part of the process.
Interview Questions: As an extrovert, how would you correspond/communicate with someone who is introverted?

title: Director of Accounts Payable Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email to set up a phone interview. I then did a few video interviews, both panel and one on one, one including my husband. This would typically be in person but due to the COVID pandemic the whole process was on video for me. There was also a series of tests that helped you learn more about yourself which I really enjoyed. They took the time to discuss your results, and you could tell that the employees interviewing you genuinely cared.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict in the workplace?

title: Software Engineer Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started out with me giving a brief but detailed description of my life story and who I am as a person. It then transitioned into my work/academics activity in which he asked me some questions about solving software problems. He went over some of my test results that I received from the screening process, and then we concluded with him allowing me to ask some questions back to him. The interview was about an hour long.
Interview Questions: I can't remember the interview questions exactly, but several of them had to do with solving random software examples/problems

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Before the process begins, I encourage you to pray and speak with leaders in your faith community. Each step was intentionally designed to search my heart and the calling before me.  It begins with a phone screening to get an initial check of culture and intent. For engineering roles, a technical interview follows that to assess your skillset. The next round is testing. This round is super insightful even if the process doesn't end with an offer. There is an opportunity for growth. After the testing, I discussed my results with a panel. Finally, my wife and I were invited to an interview event that lasted two days. The first day you attend a service and learn about Life.Church. The last day is a series of interviews that create a discernment process for both sides. At the end of the day, both you and your spouse and the interviewing team will know if Life.Church is where you are called to be. Slow down and enjoy the whole process. No matter the outcome, you will be impacted and grow from it.
Interview Questions: How are you leading outside of work?

title: Associate Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had an amazing time interviewing with Life Church back in February 2020. It is a lengthy process as they want to ensure that you fit with their culture as a Jesus follower. I had a total of coding challenge + 3 phone-interviews before they turned me down. The first 2 are culture-fit. The last one is with their Software Engineer. Despite of the outcome, this is one of the company that I will keep an eye on in the future

title: Associate Youth Pastor Interview

Interview Descriptions: After submitting an application, I heard back about a month later a request for a short video to be submitted. title: Associate Host Team Pastor Interview

title: Director of Marketing and Communications Interview

title: Product Designer Interview

Through my interview process, through personally praying and listening to God it became clear to me that I did not feel called to work for Life.Church. Ultimately, though I did not end up accepting a role from Life.Church it was a positive experience that blessed me in many ways.

title: Internship Interview

title: Associate Pastor Interview

Whew!  The interview process was an epic tale lol. It consisted of 5 parts.

title: Human Resources Partner Interview

title: Pastor Interview

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online resume, got an email asking to schedule a phone interview to get to know more about me, had the phone interview and was told I would hear back in several days, and finally I heard back in an email after several days that they would not be moving forward with me for the current position.
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioral question.

title: Campus Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is challenging but exciting. I learned a lot about the organizational values and I learned a lot about myself in the process as well. The rather lengthy process helps to ensure that those who get through will be a good fit culturally.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time you led a team towards a desired outcome.

title: Android Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I personally did not believe the phone interview went well but was surprised when I received another e-mail the following day asking me to schedule a video interview. The second interview involved one very simple technical question and, overall, I thought it went well but I did find it a bit odd that the interviewers used that one question to gauge my technical knowledge.

Two weeks after my video interview, I received another e-mail inviting my wife and me to fly out for an in-person interview.  This "interview event," as they called it, included a full weekend experience and we were told up-front that there would be other candidates there as well. Turns out, the other candidates were all there to interview for different roles.

When we arrived to pick up our rental car (all paid for by the church) we found it a bit odd that the person at the rental agency asked us if we were interviewing with Life.Church and, when we said yes, she advised us to "be careful how we interact with people because they're watching you." We thought, surely that can't be the case. Who would do that? That was the first red flag that we ignored.

Our first night there, we attended services at the OKC campus. A couple more red flags, that we initially ignored, began to surface. They don't call their worship centers anything of the sort. They are referred to as "studios" and we were left with the strong impression that this was more of a production company than a church...again, we ignored this at first because they put up a good front.

Sunday morning, we toured a number of their local facilities and attended multiple worship services in the process. Another red flag appeared when, in the middle of worship, videos of the senior pastor, Craig Groeschel, began to play. It felt very much like the congregation was worshipping Craig and not God.

During the tours of the "central offices," we also noticed that there were a number of quotes and phrases written all over the walls. As a church, you would expect these to be scripture. They were not. They were all things that Craig himself has said, not one word from God on their walls. Again, in our excitement, we initially ignored what is a huge red flag for a church.

Day three is when the actual interview took place. This began with all of the candidates and their spouses in a single room, moving from one table to the next in a "round robin" style interview. Each candidate had 6 minutes to answer 6 questions at each table. I did find this concept somewhat interesting.

After the "round robins" we were all taken into a conference room and then separated for the "second round" into different rooms. In our "second round" the first thing that was said to us was that they didn't feel I was being genuine in my answers and that they felt I had rehearsed my answers. Which as interesting since I had no way of knowing what they were going to ask me, so how could I rehearse for this? My wife and I both, rather desperately, tried to explain to them that this is simply my personality and that I was being 100% genuine in my responses.

The "third round" wasn't an interview at all. They asked us what we thought of their church. We were on the spot, so we gave them a glowing review (which we now regret.) Once they got what they were looking for there, they rather abruptly told me that they were not going to be moving forward because I don't have the amount of experience they were looking for.

Read that again: My resume explicitly states that I am a fresh graduate with no industry experience. This fact was discussed in great detail in both of my previous interviews. Why would they fly us all the way out for a "final interview" if my lack of experience was an issue for them? There was no way they weren't already aware of this.

I was in complete shock and had no idea how to respond. My wife began to cry because of the realization that they had wasted two months of our time and took us away from our children for the weekend for absolutely no reason hit her very abruptly. The moment she started to cry, they kicked us out of the building. This was at noon. Our flight home as at 6 pm.

So we suddenly found ourselves in a city hundreds of miles from home, with nowhere to go for six hours while we waited for our return flight. While we were at the airport, they called us. Not to check on us or make sure we were okay or even to apologize; but to inform us that the reimbursement check for our flights was ready and we needed to pick it up at the front desk...at the building, we just got kicked out of.

As we were sitting in the airport waiting for our flight, the other candidates began to arrive over time. They all had almost identical experiences.
Interview Questions: Why are you here? (Multiple times, with increasing aggressiveness)

title: Associate Host Team Pator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone call interview that was about 15 minuets. After that, testing was done and a follow up 45 minute video interview with 3 staff members. After that we (my spouse and I) did a 2 day interview event that was pretty much all day. I wish every company interviewed this way. It really shows the amount of care they put into who will be in charge of driving the passion that Life.Church has at each campus!
Interview Questions: Are you willing to live outside Oklahoma?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone call, some testing, another phone call, then an interview event! The interview event had several other interns there and comprised of speed dating-style interviews and multiple rounds of one-on-one interviews with different people on different teams. The testing was things like your personality type, your attention to detail, etc.
Interview Questions: What is a strength of yours? How is it a strength?  Why Life.Church? Why the internship?

title: Operations Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The screening process is thorough with a phone screen, testing, Skype interview, and video submission. Then candidates are invited to an interview weekend. This event is pretty intense, but if you can be yourself and be honest it is doable.
Interview Questions: What is critical feedback you’ve received that you didn’t agree with?

title: Digerati Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Phone-screen, video interview, pre-employment testing, large interview weekend with Monday interview day.

The first couple of things are standard-fare so I'll focus on the rest. It's worth noting this whole process can take weeks.

First, the testing is IQ/spatial awareness/intelligence stuff followed by psuedo-science Myers Briggs testing. The effectiveness of these is highly debated and most scientific studies about them have revealed bias, so it's surprising a church would continue to use them. "It's the only thing that's consistent" they say, but so was not hiring POC back in the day, so I feel like times can change and there's just refusal to do so.
"We only use them for information, not qualification" they said before I took it, but the hiring folks beat me over the head with the results of it, so I feel a bit like they were kidding themselves on this. I outscored their "average" employee score in every area but one, they picked that one out to ask why I wasn't good at it. That worried me as foreshadowing culture here (focus on the negative instead of your strengths). Just because they've used bad tools for so long is what they're continuing to do so. Tradition! From a claimed non-traditional workplace. For a perspective employee, these are large red flags.

Second, the interview weekend is on their expense, but it is a significant time investment, so just be forewarned. You'll attend and do tours on the weekend, and then on Monday you'll do several rounds of interviews with other folks. Your spouse (if you have one) is expected to attend, too. It's a significant ask and investment in the process itself for no guarantee on the other side.
Interview Questions: Tell me your best joke

title: Associate Host Team Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was pretty rigorous.  After I submitted an application, I was contacted within 14 days to schedule a video interview. Because I originally applied for two positions, I interviewed with two people simultaneously. Several days later, I received an email letting me know that I was moving into the next round and requested that I fill out several forms, documents, and take some tests to identify spiritual gifts, personality, and skills.

This testing was followed by an additional video interview and, finally, and interview to travel to Edmond, OK for a "Global Interview Event." The event was two days long. The first day consisted of tours, visits, and more information question asking. The second day was a long, emotional one consisting of round-robin style interview and small group interviews. At one point, they brought us into a large room with all of the interviewer, handed us a microphone, and said, "You have one minute to tell us everything that we need to know about you."

It was a taxing process but I think that it really spoke to the care that they take in ensuring that all staff members are a good fit, not just for the position but also for the organization and staff culture.
Interview Questions: We know that working in ministry paints a target on our backs. How would Satan take you out?

title: Social Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: There were several rounds beginning with a phone interview followed by a series of testing, another phone interview and then a  weekend on site. Overall, the process was very intense, but it ensured that the role was a good fit both for me and for them.
Interview Questions: What does your spiritual growth look like?

title: Operations Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Life.Church (Minneapolis, MN) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
In the first round of interview, I was asked baseline ministry leadership questions. Near the end, I was informed that the position I was applying for would not be the role I would be initially hired for. (I was only told this near the end of the interview and not in the posting itself nor in the initial email)

The recruiter made it sound as if this is “how we hire this role”. 

Very unprofessional to post a job, offer an interview for said role, only to be told that this is actually a entry-level train-in position which would result in the eventual role after 6months - 2 years of “training.”

Life Church, be upfront with your postings, emails, and interviews. If the position is a “trainee” position then say that up front. Bad form.
Interview Questions: What interests you in Life Church / this role?

title: LeadershipXP - Central Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and went through a preliminary phone interview where they asked some simple questions about how I felt I related to some of their values, my strengths/weaknesses, and why I applied for LXP. From there I received some testing (personality test, can-do-attitude test, spiritual gifts test, some math/reading/comprehension). I was then contacted several weeks later to participate in the final round of interviews, which were a "speed dating" type of interviews. They had 8 of us at a table, 8 stations around the room. We had 6 minutes to each interview with 1 group of interviewers, and then would all rotate around to the next group (each of us individually were with a different group of interviewers). They asked lots of intentional questions that actually made me learn more about myself. After the interviews, we were each placed in separate rooms so the interviewers could come in and review some of our answers and give us feedback or insight. After they had asked some follow-up questions, they ended up saying some really good things that were encouraging and helped me to see some things about myself that I hadn't before. The interview process was incredible and I would say that even if you don't get hired, there is tremendous value in the process, so don't count it as a failure.
Interview Questions: Which one of our values do you think you would need the most improvement in?

title: HR Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: HARD! SO worth it though. The process took four months and involved a phone interview, testing, in person group panel interview, spouse interview, presentation, and multiple projects before receiving an offer. If you are meant to be here you will get an offer. Don't pretend to be anything you are not, they will see right there. Be honest in your answers and true to yourself. This job is not temporary. You can make a career here and their goals are long term. Once hired you are family.
Interview Questions: When is the last time you received feedback?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: They asked me to select an phone interview time online. But nobody called me at that time, and even not any explanations after I asked by email. I think they are so unprofessional!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Tons of communication! I had 4 pre-screens and pre-interview testing. It was challenging, but it correlates with the importance of the work we do at LC. Interview process was a bear, a full day of very personal and intense questions. They want to make sure you know what you are betting into and they want to make sure you are the right fit. They gave a ton of feedback for positive things and things to work on.
Interview Questions: Biggest failure in your life, how did you respond

title: HR Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK)
Interview Descriptions: We really had an incredible experience and felt like the interviews themselves were development and growth opportunities. While those experiences were the most challenging  interviews I have had in my career, they were by far the most welcoming, curious and authentic.
Interview Questions: If there is one thing that Satan will do to destroy you, what will that be?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK)
Interview Descriptions: The interview processes is not only to assess your skills for the job, but your fit within the organization.  Are you involved in the church and community, actively serving, participating in a life group, etc.
Interview Questions: How has God gifted you for this role?  What challenges do you anticipate and how will you overcome those?  What expectations do you have coming in to the organization?  Are you comfortable working in a high feedback culture?

title: Associate Youth Pastor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: Preliminary Process included multiple phone screens, one informal interview and candidate testing on everything from intellect to personality type. Which lead to an interview event where a group of candidates and myself where interviewed by multiple interviewers.
Interview Questions: If anyone could play you in a movie who would it be?

title: Digerati Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
VERY long process.  I could see it being much longer for a pastor level (stage time, etc). From first apply to interview weekend was a good 3-4 weeks.

For me: initial phone screen, then 3 hours worth of competency testing, then video call to review your results, then an interview weekend. The Interview weekend is with all of the candidates and their spouses. 
On Saturday, you attend the broadcast campus to see Pastor Craig live, and then go out to dinner.
Sunday begins early and you visit about 3 different OKC Metro churches.
At any point, they might ask you to be done, however this didn’t happen for any of us on Sat/Sun.

On Monday, you go through the gauntlet of interviews of several group-style interviews, and they send all the candidates back into a conference room to wait while they talk about you, and then you do another one: rinse and repeat. The group interviews are full of people from both your team (usually leader-level) as well as other teams.
Life.Church is high feedback, and this entire process is designed to see how you react to that and let them know about you as a person. You cannot fake your way through it. Don’t even try: if you aren’t on board with the Life.Church vision and mission, they’ll find out and you won’t make it.

The entire weekend (even touring the campuses) is an interview. They’re watching your personality, how you interact with people, etc.

You’ll hear it said, and it sounds cliche, but just be yourself. You can’t fake it, and if they don’t like you for you: you won’t make it anyway. They definitely are not looking for SKILL as much as they are your fit as a person. The intentionality they put into making sure your personality fits the hole on the team is second to none and why Life.Church functions as well as it does. Trust the process.

Towards the end of the day, after a few rounds: one of the couples didn’t show back up into the conference room “holding” cell. They don’t tell you what’s going on, it’s slightly stressful (are they offering those people? Did they quit? Were they sent home?). When it was just two candidates left, they separated us again. After about 15 minutes of sitting in the conference room alone, the team leaders came in and offered the position to us. I had no idea what to think: they don’t tell you anything. Are they offering the other person a position in the other room during 15 minutes? Etc, etc, etc. It stinks to go through, I won’t sugar-coat it, but it certainly exists for a purpose and I can imagine dismissing the other candidates in such a way (separately from the others) is a graceful way to handle it.

Again, Life.Church is high-feedback, so if you can’t handle feedback well, I wouldn’t even bother applying.
Interview Questions:
How would Satan take you out? Tell a joke (if you can’t take humor- you won’t survive working at LC). Tell me about your biggest challenges. Tell me how you handle stress. 
They also very quickly latch onto things you say and ask un-scripted follow-up questions: there’s really no way to prepare. Traditional “canned” responses don’t work, here, and if you give them: they will find a way around your canned response.

title: LifeKIDS Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is extensive and intense, as it should be. But just as much as it's extensive and intense, it's fun, engaging, and energizing too! We built relationships with people that will last a lifetime. On the first day, all candidates attended a service together, Life.Church provided dinner for all candidates and we took a tour of Central. The second day we visited another campus and had the opportunity to meet with the campus pastors to ask questions and listen to words of wisdom from them, the third day was a full day of interviews with lunch provided.
Interview Questions: What was your work ethic like as a teenager?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The most difficult interview process of all time. Be prepared to cry. They get really deep into your personal life as well, so be prepared for that. If you are married or engaged, your spouse is expected to attend the interview as well. The spouse will get asked questions about themselves too.
Interview Questions: When was the last time you lied?

title: Systems Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was initially turned down - I had to emphasize some of my previous experience to get the interview. Then there was a phone screening, aptitude testing, two panel style interviews with 4-5 interviewers (one with spouse present).
Interview Questions: How do you problem solve? (What is your process)

title: Accounts Payable Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The LC interview process is a long one, but more thorough than any I have experienced.  This communicated to me that they are not only very careful with who they choose as staff but their intentionality with the process.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you failed at a task & how did you overcome it?

title: Associate Host Team Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: In a word, intentional. Not only were they looking at performance, but also character. I appreciate how intentional the team is to ensure a fit job wise and interpersonally.
Interview Questions: What are you most passionate about?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief initial phone interview. After that I was requested to have an in-person panel interview. After being selected for a final panel interview, I was also asked to complete extensive testing prior to that interview. This whole process took about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: If you were to not be selected for this job, why would you think you didn't get it?

title: Employee Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: One of the most challenging experiences and by far the hardest interview I've ever had!  This organization is committed to finding the right fit for the culture.  The questions asked are intended to gauge reactions and get a feel for who you are deep down.  They also  do a bunch of online testing prior to the major interview event (personality assessment, spiritual gifts assessment, logic/reasoning tests, etc.).  I left feeling a great deal of insight into myself and have grown so much as a person during my short two weeks here!
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you failed at work.

title: Worship Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (NONE) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Took two months to get any notification back.  Very impersonal.  Found it interesting that they didn't even do a follow up based on my creditials.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was in 4 parts. 
Phone Interview
Testing - personality, critical thinking, and common sense etc... 
Video interview
Interview event - this was split out over 3 days. 
     Saturday evening - tour, attend a service, & dinner

     group, one-on-two interview, break, one-on-two interview.
Interview Questions: What is something you might lose or have to give up to work here?

title: CENTRAL Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and had an initial phone interview about 6 weeks later. I did testing about two days later. I was invited to the Central Offices to interview with a group of about 6 leaders from the organization. I had a second interview with several other leaders which my husband attended.
Interview Questions: Tell me a joke.

title: Operations Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: First interview was great. Then invited to do a battery of tests that took about 90mins. Second interview was a panel video conference. Was difficult to know how you were coming across because you were speaking to 6 people simultaneously. I got really nervous, didn't expect panel, & did not do amazing. Even though they said all my aptitude scores were above their averages, I did not get an offer.
Interview Questions: What risk would we be taking in hiring you?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very challenging, but fun at the same time. I learned a lot about the organization and about myself. There was a lot of attention to detail, and the interviewers really wanted to get to know the candidates. The process began with a phone interview, then several online tests/assessments, two interviews via web conference, and ended with an interview weekend that my wife and I were flown in for.
Interview Questions: What area of your life would Satan use to take you out?

title: Associate Youth Pastor Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK)
Interview Descriptions: One of the most challenging, yet rewarding interview I have ever done. You leave the interview thinking I just grew so much as a leader in the past 3 hours. Be ready for hard questions. If you are honest, open and be willing to grow you will be okay!
Interview Questions: Name a time you failed

title: Associate Youth Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received a message from the central team a month later to set up an interview the next day. Then took a series of tests that took up to 90 minutes straight through. After that another youth pastor called me to discuss test results and some of my answers.  A week later I was invited out to the Edmond campus for the interview event. The interview event was incredibly intense. The first night we got to watch the service at the OKC campus followed by dinner with the department heads. The second day we got to go to the Midwest city campus and tour it and the central offices. Thankfully we got a break for majority of the afternoon because the third day was crazy. We came in on the third day and right away we had a series of 6 minute interviews where we were grilled with questions about the different values of the church.  When those were done we had lunch. That was followed by us taking turns getting up in front of a room full of people to talk about ourselves for 1 minute, no more and no less. When that was done we were taken into different offices to have a couple longer more in depth interviews. Throughout the process whenever the group of interviewees would come back together you would tend to notice that people were either dropping out themselves or were being asked to go home. The people who were left at the end of the day all received an intent to offer on the spot
Interview Questions: When was the last time your integrity was called into question?

title: Host Team Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is intense but very well done. First phone call was 25 minutes, then you go through all the screenings (personality test, spiritual gifts test, competency testing, application, and essay questions), video interview, then a 3-day hiring event. ENGAGE in the entire process! Everything is a part of the interview.
Interview Questions: We define sacrifice as giving up something you love for something you love even more. What is something you've had to sacrifice recently?

title: LifeGroups/LifeMissions Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and within a month took part in a video FaceTime interview, took part in extensive testing, a phone call interview to discuss testing results, and then was invited to the Global Interview weekend in Oklahoma City.  The overall experience was positive as LifeChurch clearly communicates their culture and how they operate.  The Monday interview process was intense and exhausting.  I appreciated their honesty, feedback (positive and negative), and how warm and inviting everyone was.  An overall very pleasant experience that I don't regret in the slightest.  That being said one applicant questioned whether this was a church masquerading as a business or a business masquerading as a church.  If you are seeking the more "traditional" pastoral role with regards to teaching/preaching/counseling/etc this may not be the best fit for you.  That is the conclusion my wife and I reached by the end of the weekend.  That being said Life Church is a fantastic organization and do everything with excellence in mind.  I am very appreciative of the opportunity to get to know them better through this process.
Interview Questions: What is one example of challenging feedback you have received and how did you receive and apply it?

title: LeadershipXP Full-Time Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Hardest but greatest interview process I have ever been through. They really consider you prayerfully at Life.Church and take the whole process very seriously. Once you apply, they ask you to take some additional testing to get to know your personality, spiritual gifts, and overall aptitude better. They use all this information in the first phone interview where you interview with a recruiter and someone from the department. I was lucky enough to be flown down to Edmond for the second round interview event. They try to keep the interview event private, but candidates are prayerfully considered and everything they do is intentional. They make you feel at home with a warm and welcoming staff member keeping you calm throughout the day. It really is a great experience and seems like an amazing place to work. Ended up declining the offer due to health issues and being unable to move away from my doctors at the time.
Interview Questions: Would you hire yourself for this position at Life.Church?

title: Youth LeadershipXP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was extremely challenging. You will walk away physically, emotionally, and mentally drained. It is a great learning experience and you receive a ton of feedback in real time. The process starts out with an internship application; continues to the first phone interview; then involves a job application, background check, personality test, spiritual gifts test, and a series of aptitude tests; followed by the second phone interview, then an on-site two day interview event. The on-site interview event involved a weekend service, an evening dinner, round robin interviewing, public speaking, role playing, and purity/spiritual integrity interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you experienced your greatest failure? How did you respond to your failure?

title: Central Ful-time Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I did a phone interview for about 30 minutes. I took a lot of tests, ranging from personality to ability to ministry tests. I had a skype interview where they went over my test results, and they really dug into my results. After that, I was invited to the Central Offices in Edmond to participate in a group interview (the final step). They had us do speed dating interviews, and then broke us up into rooms for two longer interviews to dig deeper into our responses. I received my internship offer and placement 3 days later. A few reviews say "get ready to cry", but as long as you are confident in yourself and who you are, you will do great. No tears were shed during my group interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you received feedback you did not agree with at first, but now agree?

title: Associate Youth Minister Interview

The staff is great about breaking up the day, before heading to more personal, one on one interviews. It’s a log, exhausting day.
Interview Questions: How does Satan attack your marriage?

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a 2-3 month process.  I applied, had a phone interview, skype interview, online testing that took a few hours followed by a weekend interview with a large group.
Interview Questions:

title: LifeKIDS Coordinator Interview

title: Intern Interview

title: Associate Operations Pastor Interview

Interview Questions: Why did I feel called to this position.

title: Life Groups Life Missions Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Feb 2018

title: Associate Youth Pastor Interview

Interview Descriptions: The process itself was difficult but at the same time very empowering to you as a leader. The interview  process will help you know if Life.Church is a fit for you and who you are as a leader.

title: Digerati LXP Interview

title: Project Leader Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied online to this role and they scheduled a phone interview. I was excited to talk to them and use my 20+ years of technical skills for good.  The lady was nice, said I had great skills. But her only interest was in my faith, how religious I was. She asked me to tell her about when I accepted Christ into my life. While I'm deeply spiritual I am also very private. I am not an evangelist type. There were no questions related to the job or my technical skills. She is the front end "gate keeper" to see how religious I was. I was deeply disappointed in the process and finding out that they are very exclusive in this manner.
Interview Questions: Tell me about then you accepted Christ into your life.

title: Associate Youth Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: By FAR the most intense thing I’ve ever been through. Then I had 48 hours to fill out and do several questionnaires, background checks, personality tests, etc. Then I had another phone interview where they asked more in depth questions about my skills, expectations, passions, ministry strategies, etc. Then I was flown to Oklahoma for a weekend interview event. We were able to attend a service, go to different campuses, meet leaders, and then the actual interviews began Monday. I’m not going to tell you all they do and ask because I don’t want to ruin the fun ;) but basically I slept 20 of the 24 hours the next day. It was crazy!
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you failed and learned something

title: IOS Developer Interview
