title: Worship Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Challenging and life-giving interview process. Began with a phone interview, then walked through some self awareness testing, and finally went through an on-site interview. This on-site interview consisted of a round robin style phase of questions, then two one on one interview sessions.
Interview Questions: What was one time you took a risk and failed?

title: Youth Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The entire process is very intense. There are many rounds of interviewing and each comes with a different difficulty. There is round robin style questions, communication run through, and intense leadership questioning.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Life.Church?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Tulsa, OK) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: a group of people applying for the job interviewed altogether. there were 6 people interviewing us and we had 5 minutes to answer each person's questions. we moved chairs every 5 minutes but we couldnt hear the others because we were far enough away
Interview Questions: why you're a good fit

title: Frontend Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Life.Church in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I would have loved to work here, but they REQUIRE you to be apart of the congregation. Which means they want to take 15% of your income for tithing.

I've been to the church and after the band the pastor speaks on a TV for 45 minutes and 15 minutes is about tithing with automatic deductions.
Interview Questions: Can you show me some of the websites you've done.

title: Life Groups Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: It was lengthy and unclear. I was told to attend an informal interview at a coffee shop and it ended up being more of an interrogation than an interview. One person was very nice the other very rude. Strange. It was an unusually process and it took them a very long time to make a decision. I have heard other people say the same things about this organization.
Interview Questions: Tell us a joke was the final question.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was like none I had ever been a part of. It was very detailed and thorough and intense. Ultimately it ended on an interview weekend where I spent the entire day going through different interview aspects designed to to get to the heart of who I was and would I be a fit culturally for the organization.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation in which you had to lead?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Lots of superficial questions that did not relate to the job I was applying for. If you gave what they deemed "cookie cutter" answers, they would tell you they would not accept the answer and to come up with another.

About halfway through the interview, I could see that all of this was fake, and that the questions were designed to build a character bio to see if you would be pleasant to work with, not if you would actually be good at the job.

Due to my answers, I didn't get the job. As someone who grew up going to that church, who knew the ins-and-outs, and who went to the Christian school that was adjacent to Life Church's main campus, I was appalled by their decisions to see people as a number as opposed to a person. A friend of mine got the graphic design position there a year later and they hated it. Within 3 months, they were already trying to desperately leave that place. I was able to find a less superficial church to freelance for that actually wanted me as a person and not as a minion.
Interview Questions: What accomplishment are you most proud of in your life so far?

title: Directory of IT Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: 4 month process involved missed calls, no replies and multiple excuses as to why/how an email or call didn't make it to me. Tried to involve management and they didn't care to improve or take ownership of process either.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Online Host Team Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: First round interview was scheduled quickly.  They explained what the process would be.  I knew by the end of the week I was not moving on to the next round.  It was handled very professionally.
Interview Questions: It was really an interview to get to know me as a person.  I could tell they knew what they wanted in the applicants.  They covered personal, professional and spiritual questions.

title: Central Team Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK)
Interview Descriptions: A bit drawn out. Very thorough with testing and multiple interviews. It's clear that they care about getting the right people in the right role. Team chemistry and cultural fit are very important. My spouse was required to be in the final interview, which I really appreciated. It's great when you can process together and make the decision together.
Interview Questions:
How would Satan take you out?
What do you value in a leader?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was absolutely wonderful.   After reviewing my resume, preliminary testing, and phone screenings, Life.Church paid for my flight and hotel stay to interview.  All details were fully communicated about the process.  For other candidates, spouses were even flown in for the event.  You could tell the staff really cared for the people they were hiring.  Their goal was to make sure you fit in the culture and love the mission of the church otherwise it would not be a good fit for either party.
Interview Questions: They asked me what was a big failure of mine in life and what I did about it

title: Host Team Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The full interview process was a 3-day experience designed to help us understand the culture of Life.Church and for them to get to know me and my family. The interview event itself pulled multiple candidates (and spouses) for multiple open positions together to do basic interview questions through a rotation process. Then each candidate was ranked. Folks who made it to the next couple rounds had the opportunity to be interviewed in more of a one-on-one setting with their spouse. After that, the final portion was a communication practice, where we drew a topic out of a hat, had 10 minute to prepare a 6-minute talk on the topic and present it to the whole group of candidates and interviewers.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question I was asked was about how failing in my previous job shaped me.

title: LifeGroup & Missions Project Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Jenks, OK) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very intense but well worth the process. You learn a lot about yourself in the interview and every conversation regardless of if you are in the actual interview or just at dinner is part of the process. If you make it to the other side there is a very high rate of success,very few will not make it past the 90 days. This is why the interview is very intense because they want to set the organization as a whole up to succeed. Know that it is not just you interview, your spouse is also a part of the interview as well.
Interview Questions: If I told you in 2 months you had to recruit 50 Lifegroups how would you make that happen?

title: Associate Youth Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK)
Interview Descriptions: Lots of intentional questions and "pressure cooker" situations. They want to get to know the REAL you. Not just an interview master. They'll ask a lot of situational questions to see how you would react in different circumstances, and they'll ask you to tell stories from your life to help them understand if you're a good fit for them. They're not looking for just someone who can do the job. They're looking for someone who is already on board with the vision they have as a church.
Interview Questions: How would the enemy attack you if you took this job?

title: Technical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Multiple levels of pre-interview phone calls, testing (Aptitude, CDAT, M/B, Spiritual Gifts...) prior to on-site interview.  On-site interview was panel style and included my spouse.  I enjoyed the process very much as it showed the premium they place and the time they take on trying to hire the right candidates.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Production Artist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a one-on-one interview with the department director.  It went well and I was impressed with the department - unfortunately, I was the only female in sight.  After a 2-month hiatus in communication, I was asked in for a second interview which as horribly intimidating after such a long lull. I was introduced to a boardroom of people.  I am hopeful the process hole that leads to the lag and the communication shortcomings has been fixed.  And that the team has added some female perspectives since then.  In the end, I did not get an offer and I respect their decision in that.   I was overqualified for the job and they saw that my contentment with the position would not last.
Interview Questions: Where I wanted to be in 5 years

title: Worship Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at LifeChurch.tv is pretty intense! Typically a round-robin interview style, the candidate and spouse will encounter three, 30 minute interviews with a team of 6-10 LifeChurch team members. There's really not a way to prepare for the interviews and my advice to a potential candidate would be to simply be yourself.
Interview Questions: We didn't expect the process to be as spiritually life-giving as it was. It was hard but incredible.

title: Campus Administration Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church
Interview Descriptions: The interview process had several steps but was quick and clear. After submitting my résumé, I had an initial Skype interview, testing, a follow-up Skype interview, and then an in-person interview. Other final candidates were also present at the in-person interview, which was very awkward. Several questions asked were borderline inappropriate, but the intention was clear and understood.
Interview Questions: If we don't hire you, which of the other candidates present do you think we should hire?

title: Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Several Skype interviews followed by an intensive one day onsite. The one day onsite consisted of several panel interviews, testing, and a final meeting with the planned manager. Very thorough interview.
Interview Questions: They asked me to tell them a joke about something.

title: LifeGroups/LifeMissions Pastor Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Clayton, NC) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I went through three different interviews before even going to Oklahoma City for the interview weekend. The weekend in Oklahoma City begins with attending the main campus on Saturday night and then a follow up get-together. On Sunday morning all of the candidates meet at the central office and tour four different campuses. That sounds fine until you realize that you were being interviewed in the car between every single campus. There is absolutely no downtime. You are constantly being interviewed and looked over. Then, if you make it to the Monday morning interviews, that’s where you go in for testing and afterwards the interview process begins again. You are sitting in the lobby and they come out and select you to go back and be interviewed by two people in an office. That goes on for about 10 minutes and then you go back into the lobby and hope your name is called for the next round. This repeats two or three more times. If you make it through all of those rounds like I did, then you are taken into the Conference room where you are told to choose number 1, 2, or 3. After you have chosen a number they give you a topic that you have to construct a sermon off of without using your phone. Some of the topics included plastic surgery and masturbation. After the 10 minutes is over for your preparation you are taken into what they call, Studio B, where their guest speakers preach from. You go on stage and preach in front of a crowd of people. It’s very intimidating. But I did feel like I grew as a leader through this entire process. I do think it was a little bit over-the-top, but they have to weed out all of the non-hackers.

I didn’t get this particular job but I did get another position at one of the campuses which was also a pastoral position.
Interview Questions: If you were on the football field, would you rather be the quarterback or the head coach?

title: Associate Campus Pastor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at LifeChurch.tv is very intense, but very informational and infighting.  You will truly walk away from the process learning so much about yourself and the LifeChurch.tv culture.
Interview Questions: The questions are unclose and personal

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial Communication-very professional yet friendly, genuine. Somewhat of a lengthy interview process (but its because they want to make sure that you are right for the job and that the job is right for you.) Application with portfolio/resume, phone interview, testing, and finally a team chemistry interview.
Interview Questions: What is one weakness that you have and how do you manage it?

title: Content Partnerships Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview helped me get to know the people I'd be working with, what the role is, and some of the set backs that I might experience if I got the role. I felt appreciated and that their questions were to really get to know me. I left my interview feeling like this team is doing important things and will thoughtfully consider the best person for the role.
Interview Questions: How do you think your experiences [in the customer service industry] will impact the way you view this role?

title: Crestive Media Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Began with email, phone interview, then two in person interviews in front of a panel, one with my spouse and one without. I've also seen interviews with others via Skype. The process was very transparent, and any information I requested was given. Be honest, and make sure you are passionate about furthering the ministry of Christ in the area you are interviewing for. If you just apply for a lot of different positions because you want to work for LifeChurch.tv, you will not get interviewed.
My interview process took 4 months, but that is atypical. I would expect most processes to take between 2 weeks to 1 month.
Interview Questions: Defending the direction I took in the project that I submitted prior to the interview, and speaking about what might make me most vulnerable in the future in regards to being able to successfully fulfill the demands of my position.

title: IT Development Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Job posting on website, application with resume, Phone screen, Skype Video Screen, In-person visit, personality testing, competency testing, spiritual gifts testing, In-person interview with two different panels, phone and email offer, counter offer, accepted
Interview Questions: What risk is LifeChurch.tv taking in hiring you?

title: Central Team Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very long process. Applied for position, emailed 3 weeks later and asked to answer questions via email. A few days later I was asked to interview via Skype and then over the phone. A panel interview was scheduled for a week later. The panel consisted of 5 people at a round table. LOTS of questions, took just under an hour. They tried to make it comfortable and pleasant but if you answered a question in a way they didn't like, they all passed looks at each other and you definitely knew you didn't answer right. That made me feel uncomfortable :(  They did not let me know if I had the job or not until I contacted them a week later.  I didn't get the job and when I asked for feedback they just told me they didn't think I would like it and I didn't have enough passion for the job.
Interview Questions: Why do think you would be good at this job?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Life.Church (Edmond, OK) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume online and was contacted within 1 week. Initial phone screening was scheduled for a few days later, after that I was asked to complete extensive testing (CDAT, Keirsey temperment, spiritual gifts, etc.), and based on those results I was selected to move on to the last round, which was a group interview in which test results are discussed.
Interview Questions: Questions about some of the test results were difficult, as they hold these results very high and will challenge you with questions about your weaknesses
